p: The vertical distribution of TOC content ranged from 0.59% to 1.02% (with an average 0.81%) for the ECH and from 0.67% to 1.52% (with an average 0.99%) for the WCH, showing an increasing trend with time ( Figure 4a). This showed that there was no significant difference between ECH and WCH before the 1970s, while the TOC content at the WCH has been significantly higher than that at the ECH since the 1970s. The TN content showed a similar trend ( Figure 4b), varying from 0.072% to 0.153% and from 0.086% to 0.259% for the ECH and WCH, respectively. The average content of TN at the WCH was about 1.28 times as that at the ECH since the 1860s, and increased to 1.43 times since the 1970s. There was a significant relationship between TOC and TN in both cores (R 2 = 0.96, p < 0.01), indicating that the nitrogen was mainly in the form of organic nitrogen.
